00003 /* Interface to BigDigits "mp" functions */

00022 #ifndef BIGDIGITS_H_
00023 #define BIGDIGITS_H_ 1
00024 
00025 #ifdef __cplusplus
00026 extern "C" {
00027 #endif
00028 
00029 #include <stddef.h>
00030 
00031 /* Define type of DIGIT here */
00032 typedef unsigned long DIGIT_T;
00033 typedef unsigned short HALF_DIGIT_T;
00034 
00035 /* Sizes to suit your machine (see README) */
00036 #define MAX_DIGIT 0xffffffff
00037 #define MAX_HALF_DIGIT 0xffffL  /* NB 'L' */
00038 #define BITS_PER_DIGIT 32
00039 #define BITS_PER_HALF_DIGIT 16
00040 #define BYTES_PER_DIGIT (BITS_PER_DIGIT / 8)
00041 #define HIBITMASK 0x80000000
00042 
00043 /* Removed in version 2 ---->
00044   [Max number of digits expected in a mp array]
00045 //[#define MAX_DIG_LEN 51]
00046         This [was] required for temp storage only in:
00047         mpModulo, mpShortMod, mpModMult, mpGcd,
00048         mpModInv, mpIsPrime
00049    Changed to use mpAlloc.
00050 <--- */
00051 
00052 /* Useful macros */
00053 #define LOHALF(x) ((DIGIT_T)((x) & MAX_HALF_DIGIT))
00054 #define HIHALF(x) ((DIGIT_T)((x) >> BITS_PER_HALF_DIGIT & MAX_HALF_DIGIT))
00055 #define TOHIGH(x) ((DIGIT_T)((x) << BITS_PER_HALF_DIGIT))
00056 
00057 #define ISODD(x) ((x) & 0x1)
00058 #define ISEVEN(x) (!ISODD(x))
00059 
00060 #define mpISODD(x, n) (x[0] & 0x1)
00061 #define mpISEVEN(x, n) (!(x[0] & 0x1))
00062 
00063 #define mpNEXTBITMASK(mask, n) if(mask==1){mask=HIBITMASK;n--;}else{mask>>=1;}
00064 
00065 
00066 char *copyright_notice(void);
00067         /* Forces linker to include copyright notice in executable */
00068 
00069 
00070 /*      Multiple precision calculations 
00071         Using known, equal ndigits
00072         except where noted
00073 */
00074 
00075 DIGIT_T mpAdd(DIGIT_T w[], const DIGIT_T u[], const DIGIT_T v[], size_t ndigits);
00076         /* Computes w = u + v, returns carry */
00077 
00078 DIGIT_T mpSubtract(DIGIT_T w[], const DIGIT_T u[], const DIGIT_T v[], size_t ndigits);
00079         /* Computes w = u - v, returns borrow */
00080 
00081 int mpMultiply(DIGIT_T w[], const DIGIT_T u[], const DIGIT_T v[], size_t ndigits);
00082         /* Computes product w = u * v 
00083            u, v = ndigits long; w = 2 * ndigits long */
00084 
00085 int mpDivide(DIGIT_T q[], DIGIT_T r[], const DIGIT_T u[], 
00086         size_t udigits, DIGIT_T v[], size_t vdigits);
00087         /* Computes quotient q = u / v and remainder r = u mod v 
00088            q, r, u = udigits long; v = vdigits long
00089            Warning: Trashes q and r first */
00090 
00091 int mpSquare(DIGIT_T w[], const DIGIT_T x[], size_t ndigits);
00092         /* Computes square w = x^2
00093            x = ndigits long; w = 2 * ndigits long */
00094 
00095 int mpModulo(DIGIT_T r[], const DIGIT_T u[], size_t udigits, 
00096                          DIGIT_T v[], size_t vdigits);
00097         /* Computes r = u mod v 
00098            u = udigits long; r, v = vdigits long */
00099 
00100 int mpModMult(DIGIT_T a[], const DIGIT_T x[], const DIGIT_T y[], const DIGIT_T m[], size_t ndigits);
00101         /* Computes a = (x * y) mod m */
00102 
00103 int mpModExp(DIGIT_T y[], const DIGIT_T x[], const DIGIT_T n[], const DIGIT_T d[], size_t ndigits);
00104         /* Computes y = x^n mod d */
00105 
00106 int mpModInv(DIGIT_T inv[], const DIGIT_T u[], const DIGIT_T v[], size_t ndigits);
00107         /*      Computes inv = u^-1 mod v */
00108 
00109 int mpGcd(DIGIT_T g[], const DIGIT_T x[], const DIGIT_T y[], size_t ndigits);
00110         /* Computes g = gcd(x, y) */
00111 
00112 int mpEqual(const DIGIT_T a[], const DIGIT_T b[], size_t ndigits);
00113         /* Returns true if a == b, else false */
00114 
00115 int mpCompare(const DIGIT_T a[], const DIGIT_T b[], size_t ndigits);
00116         /* Returns sign of (a - b) */
00117 
00118 int mpIsZero(const DIGIT_T a[], size_t ndigits);
00119         /* Returns true if a == 0, else false */
00120 
00121 /* Bitwise operations */
00122 
00123 DIGIT_T mpShiftLeft(DIGIT_T a[], const DIGIT_T b[],
00124         size_t x, size_t ndigits);
00125         /* Computes a = b << x, x < BITS_PER_DIGIT */
00126 
00127 DIGIT_T mpShiftRight(DIGIT_T a[], const DIGIT_T b[],
00128         size_t x, size_t ndigits);
00129         /* Computes a = b >> x, x < BITS_PER_DIGIT */
00130 
00131 /* Other mp utilities */
00132 
00133 void mpSetZero(DIGIT_T a[], size_t ndigits);
00134         /* Sets a = 0 */
00135 
00136 void mpSetDigit(DIGIT_T a[], DIGIT_T d, size_t ndigits);
00137         /* Sets a = d where d is a single digit */
00138 
00139 void mpSetEqual(DIGIT_T a[], const DIGIT_T b[], size_t ndigits);
00140         /* Sets a = b */
00141 
00142 size_t mpSizeof(const DIGIT_T a[], size_t ndigits);
00143         /* Returns size of significant non-zero digits in a */
00144 
00145 size_t mpBitLength(const DIGIT_T *d, size_t ndigits);
00146         /* Returns no of significant bits in d */
00147 
00148 int mpIsPrime(const DIGIT_T w[], size_t ndigits, size_t t);
00149         /* Returns true if w > 2 is a probable prime 
00150            t tests using FIPS-186-2/Rabin-Miller */
00151 
00152 int mpRabinMiller(const DIGIT_T w[], size_t ndigits, size_t t);
00153         /* Just the FIPS-186-2/Rabin-Miller test 
00154            without trial division by small primes */
00155 
00156 
00157 /* mpShort = mp x single digit calculations */
00158 
00159 DIGIT_T mpShortAdd(DIGIT_T w[], const DIGIT_T u[], DIGIT_T d, size_t ndigits);
00160         /* Computes w = u + d, returns carry */
00161 
00162 DIGIT_T mpShortSub(DIGIT_T w[], const DIGIT_T u[], DIGIT_T v, size_t ndigits);
00163         /* Computes w = u - v, returns borrow */
00164 
00165 DIGIT_T mpShortMult(DIGIT_T p[], const DIGIT_T x[], DIGIT_T y, size_t ndigits);
00166         /* Computes product p = x * y */
00167 
00168 DIGIT_T mpShortDiv(DIGIT_T q[], const DIGIT_T u[], DIGIT_T v, size_t ndigits);
00169         /* Computes q = u / v, returns remainder */
00170 
00171 DIGIT_T mpShortMod(const DIGIT_T a[], DIGIT_T d, size_t ndigits);
00172         /* Returns r = a mod d */
00173 
00174 int mpShortCmp(const DIGIT_T a[], DIGIT_T b, size_t ndigits);
00175         /* Returns sign of (a - b) where b is a single digit */
00176 
00177 /* Single precision calculations (double where necessary) */
00178 
00179 /* NOTE spMultiply and spDivide are used by almost all mp functions. 
00180    Using the Intel MASM alternatives gives significant speed improvements
00181    -- to use, define USE_SPASM as a preprocessor directive and link
00182    to spASM.c instead of to spMultiply.c and spDivide.c
00183 */
00184 #ifdef USE_SPASM
00185         #define spMultiply spasmMultiply
00186         #define spDivide spasmDivide
00187         #pragma message("Using MASM")
00188         #pragma comment(exestr, "MASM Version")
00189 #endif
00190 
00191 int spMultiply(DIGIT_T p[2], DIGIT_T x, DIGIT_T y);
00192         /* Computes p = x * y */
00193 
00194 DIGIT_T spDivide(DIGIT_T *q, DIGIT_T *r, const DIGIT_T u[2], DIGIT_T v);
00195         /* Computes quotient q = u / v, remainder r = u mod v */
00196 
00197 
00198 /* Random number functions. CAUTION: NOT thread-safe */
00199 
00200 DIGIT_T spSimpleRand(DIGIT_T lower, DIGIT_T upper);
00201         /* Returns a simple pseudo-random digit between lower and upper */
00202 DIGIT_T spBetterRand(void);
00203         /*      Returns a "better" pseudo-random digit. */
00204 
00205 /* Print utilities */
00206 
00207 void mpPrint(const DIGIT_T *p, size_t len);
00208         /* Print all digits incl leading zero digits */
00209 void mpPrintNL(const DIGIT_T *p, size_t len);
00210         /* Print all digits with newlines */
00211 void mpPrintTrim(const DIGIT_T *p, size_t len);
00212         /* Print but trim leading zero digits */
00213 void mpPrintTrimNL(const DIGIT_T *p, size_t len);
00214         /* Print, trim leading zeroes, add newlines */
00215 
00216 /* Conversion utilities */
00217 
00218 size_t mpConvFromOctets(DIGIT_T a[], size_t ndigits, const unsigned char *c, size_t nbytes);
00219         /* Converts nbytes octets into big digit a of max size ndigits
00220            Returns actual number of digits set */
00221 size_t mpConvToOctets(const DIGIT_T a[], size_t ndigits, unsigned char *c, size_t nbytes);
00222         /* Convert big digit a into string of octets, in big-endian order,
00223            padding to nbytes or truncating if necessary.
00224            Return number of non-zero octets required. */
00225 size_t mpConvFromDecimal(DIGIT_T a[], size_t ndigits, const char *s);
00226         /* Convert a string in decimal format to a big digit.
00227            Return actual number of digits set. */
00228 size_t mpConvToDecimal(const DIGIT_T a[], size_t ndigits, char *s, size_t smax);
00229         /* Convert big digit a into a string in decimal format, 
00230            where s has max size smax.
00231            Return number of chars required excluding leading zeroes. */
00232 size_t mpConvFromHex(DIGIT_T a[], size_t ndigits, const char *s);
00233         /* Convert a string in hexadecimal format to a big digit.
00234            Return actual number of digits set. */
00235 size_t mpConvToHex(const DIGIT_T a[], size_t ndigits, char *s, size_t smax);
00236         /* Convert big digit a into a string in hexadecimal format, 
00237            where s has max size smax.
00238            Return number of chars required excluding leading zeroes. */
00239

00243 void mpFree(DIGIT_T **p);
